intro: Goniothalamus calcareus, commonly known as the limestone mountain ash, is a tropical tree species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often whitish bark that can calcify over time. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, and its fruits are fleshy berries containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in limestone-rich soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
